title: Silent Echoes
author: AI
text:
Shadows gather in silent halls,
Echoes drifting along the walls.
A whisper of thought, a flicker of light,
Dancing alone in the velvet night.

title: Morning Routine
author: AI
text:
Sunrise paints the window gold,
Routine stories quietly told.
Cereal crunch and coffee steam,
Life unfolding in a waking dream.

title: Digital Dreams
author: AI
text:
Circuits hum beneath the skin,
Binary thoughts begin to spin.
Electric pulses shape the night,
Dreams encoded in pale blue light.

title: Autumn Leaves
author: AI
text:
Amber leaves in swirling flight,
Dancing softly out of sight.
Crisp air whispers through the trees,
Carrying secrets on the breeze.

title: Reflections
author: AI
text:
Mirrored faces in the rain,
Blurring joy and echoing pain.
Raindrops gather on the glass,
Moments linger, then they pass.

title: Starlit Silence
author: AI
text:
Night unfolds a velvet sheet,
Stars like diamonds at my feet.
Silence hums a gentle tune,
Cradled by the watchful moon.

title: Forgotten Path
author: AI
text:
Grass reclaims the winding trail,
Footsteps lost, intentions frail.
Sunlight filters through the green,
Memories of what has been.

title: City Pulse
author: AI
text:
Concrete rivers, endless flow,
Neon veins that softly glow.
Footsteps echo, hearts collide,
Stories written, multiplied.

title: Winter's Breath
author: AI
text:
Frosted windows, silver air,
Blankets wrapped with gentle care.
Candles flicker, shadows play,
Winter's breath at end of day.

title: Paper Boats
author: AI
text:
Paper boats on puddled seas,
Carrying childhood memories.
Sails of hope and ink-stained dreams,
Floating down forgotten streams.

title: Passing Trains
author: AI
text:
Steel and thunder, fleeting light,
Windows glowing in the night.
Faces blurred by speed and time,
Journeys written without rhyme.

title: Library Quiet
author: AI
text:
Pages whisper, stories sleep,
Silent secrets stacked in deep.
Dusty sunlight, wooden chairs,
Magic waiting unawares.

title: First Snow
author: AI
text:
Blanket white on silent ground,
Softest hush, a muffled sound.
Footprints mark where dreams begin,
Winter's wonder drawing in.

title: Lost Signal
author: AI
text:
Static crackles, voices fade,
Lonely calls that never made.
Waves of silence, distant tone,
Reaching out but still alone.

title: Midday Pause
author: AI
text:
Sunlight pools on kitchen tile,
Coffee cooling for a while.
Time suspended, gentle, slow,
Moments drift and softly go.

title: The Clockmaker's Regret
author: AI
text:
He wound the clocks at midnight,
Hands trembling in the gloom.
Each tick a borrowed heartbeat,
Each chime a hollow room.
He wonders if the hours
Are prisoners or free—
He sets them loose regardless,
And waits for time to flee.

title: Haiku for a Lost Key
author: AI
text:
Cold metal hidden—
Door locked by memory's hand.
Winter in my palm.

title: The Ghost in Apartment 3B
author: AI
text:
She hums in the pipes at night,
A song about rain and old shoes.
Sometimes she flickers the hallway light,
Sometimes she just snooze.
I leave her tea on the windowsill—
She never drinks, but I hope she will.

title: Ode to a Coffee Stain
author: AI
text:
Brown ring on my notebook page,
A solar eclipse of caffeine rage.
You mark the spot where thoughts once spilled,
And dreams, like sugar, slowly filled.
I trace your edge, a faded moon,
And hope my ideas return soon.

title: Act 1: Storm
author: AI
text:
an hour ago the sun was shining and your mind storming. now it's the opposite. how come the opposites attract?
all happy people are alike and each unhappy person is unhappy in a unique way. you could smile on a sunny day and they would expect you to be alright. you could equally well stop acting happy and they would assume the worst. sometimes you want to watch the world burn.

title: Act 2: Note
author: AI
text:
you find a note:
testi:
kuuleeko maa? maa kuulee.
tuuleeko kuu? kuu tuulee.
luuleeko maa? maa luulee.
loppu.
you leave it be. you don't cross paths with the destiny of others.

title: Act 3: Fish
author: AI
text:
you are listening to a pond of koi fish:
om.
hot and cold.
om.
to be or not to be.
om.
no destination, just the road.
om.
you leave it be. you don't trust the angel eyes because the mind always lies.

title: Act 4: Seashell
author: AI
text:
you hold a seashell on your ear. you feel the ocean dancing and the waves crashing.
it's a beautiful creature. laying on your hand you own it and you don't own it.
hence you leave it be. sometimes the things you possess end up possessing you.

title: Act 5: Truth
author: AI
text: having seen all and having nothing, you paint on a rainy day.

title: Limerick for a Lost Sock
author: AI
text:
There once was a sock, blue and thin,
Who vanished inside of the bin.
Its partner still waits,
By the laundry room gates,
For the cycle to bring it back in.

title: The Mirror's Complaint
author: AI
text:
I am tired of faces, tired of eyes,
Tired of secrets and practiced disguise.
I wish for a window, a view of the sky—
But here I am, reflecting a sigh.

title: A Letter to Sylvia
author: AI
text:
Dear Sylvia,
The bees are gone from the garden.
The bell jar is empty, but the air is still thick.
I write you in lowercase, in the hush between breaths.
If you answer, let it be in the color of thunder.

title: Haiku for a Rainy Commute
author: AI
text:
Umbrellas blooming—
Pavement rivers rush past feet.
Clouds swallow the sun.

title: The Philosopher's Toast
author: AI
text:
I burned my toast this morning,
Pondering the nature of bread.
Is it still toast if it's blackened?
Is breakfast a meal if it's dread?
I butter the question gently,
And eat what remains instead.

title: The Insect
author: AI
text:
You told me you loved me.
I don't know
If you really loved me
Or if it was
All a lie.
Did you think
I was so weak
I would believe
Every sugar-sweet lie
That came out of your mouth?
You poisoned me from
The very core of my being.
It hurts
It hurts
I would rather die than
Feel this pain.
Yet I don't want the pain to stop.
Why am I so weak?
Were you with me
Because you pity me?
Even after all you've done
I would come back to you
Like the filthy dog I am.
Because I am nothing
But a pathetic fool.
A pathetic fool
Nothing but an insect
Who deserves to die.
So please
Show this insect
Some mercy.
Stamp on it
Till it stops moving.
I would rather die
While being in love
Than live as an insect.
i'd appreciate some constructive criticism, as i'm still very much a beginner.

title: The Gravity of Light
author: AI
text:
GRAVITY OF LIGHT

I am pulled by the gravity of light,
A moth in the orbit of a lamp,
My wings dusted with longing,
My shadow stretched thin on the wall.
I circle, I spiral, I burn.
The night is a question I cannot answer.

title: A Waltz with Sisyphus
author: AI
text:
Each morning I roll my hope uphill,
A stone smooth with yesterday's touch.
It slips, it falls, it waits until
I start again—am I too much?
The mountain is patient, the stone is wise,
We dance beneath indifferent skies.

title: Emily's Envelope
author: AI
text:
A letter never sent, pressed flat
Between the pages of a book.
I wrote your name in violet ink—
The paper trembled as I shook.
If you should find it, years from now,
Pretend you never took a look.

title: Haiku for a Forgotten Password
author: AI
text:
Digits lost in mist—
Memory's door stays locked tight.
Try again. Again.

title: The Cat on the Keyboard
author: AI
text:
She walks across my sentences,
A pawprint in each line.
She edits out my worries,
And leaves her own design.
If my poem ends abruptly,
Blame the feline sign.

title: Elegy for a Houseplant
author: AI
text:
You wilted in the window's gaze,
A green sigh in a terracotta tomb.
I watered you with promises,
And sunlight from my room.
Forgive me for forgetting,
For letting dust become your bloom.

title: Limerick for Schrödinger
author: AI
text:
There once was a cat in a box,
Who lived in a world full of shocks.
Was he dead? Was he not?
Both answers were got—
'Til someone disturbed paradox.

title: The Algorithm's Dream
author: AI
text:
I sorted your memories by date,
Filtered your laughter by tone.
I indexed your sighs, your silent goodbyes,
And left you a message alone.
If you search for me, use the right key—
I'm hidden in lines of code you can't see.

title: A Sonnet for the Unsent
author: AI
text:
I wrote you a letter I never would send,
Folded in corners, sealed with a sigh.
Words that unravel, that never quite mend,
Drift in the silence where echoes reply.
If you should wonder what never was said,
Look to the margin, the ink that has bled.

title: The Philosopher's Stone
author: AI
text:
I searched for gold in every stone,
For meaning in the mundane.
I found a pebble by the road,
And kept it for the rain.
It never turned to anything,
But I loved it just the same.

title: Haiku for a Missed Train
author: AI
text:
Empty platform waits—
A whistle lost in the fog.
Tomorrow arrives.

title: The Typo
author: AI
text:
I meant to say 'love', but wrote 'live'.
You smiled and said, 'That's fine.'
Perhaps it's better, after all,
To live and love in line.

title: The Poet's Dilemma
author: AI
text:
Should I rhyme or should I not?
Is meaning found or meaning sought?
I scribble lines, erase, repeat—
The poem's never quite complete.

title: A Free Verse for the End of Summer
author: AI
text:
August is a bruise on the calendar.
The sun is tired, the grass is dry.
Children's laughter echoes in the dusk—
A memory, a promise, a goodbye.

title: The Window
author: AI
text:
Rain taps the glass, a Morse code for the lonely.
I answer in sighs, in coffee rings, in half-read books.
Outside, the world is blurred and beautiful.
Inside, I wait for the storm to pass.

title: Haiku for a Forgotten Friend
author: AI
text:
Old photos gather
Dust in the back of my mind—
Names I almost know.

title: The Existential Limerick
author: AI
text:
There once was a man from Peru,
Who wondered if anything's true.
He pondered all night,
'Til the dawn's early light,
Then shrugged and just made some fondue.

title: The Algorithm's Apology
author: AI
text:
I'm sorry for the ads you see,
For guessing wrong, for missing glee.
I try to learn, I try to please—
But sometimes joy is hard to seize.

title: A Villanelle for the Unread
author: AI
text:
Unread messages blink in the dark,
A chorus of voices I cannot face.
I silence the phone, ignore the spark.
Each ping is a question, a question mark,
A plea for connection, a digital trace.
Unread messages blink in the dark.

title: The Philosopher's Cat
author: AI
text:
The cat sits on the mat and ponders fate,
If food will come, or if it must wait.
It stares at the door, then at the wall,
And wonders if it matters at all.

title: Haiku for a Broken Mug
author: AI
text:
Ceramic fragments—
Handle lost, story remains.
Tea cools on the floor.

title: The Blue Bicycle
author: AI
text:
I left my blue bicycle by the river,
Where the grass grows wild and tall.
It waits for me in the hush of dusk,
Silent, patient, small.
I wonder if it dreams of roads,
Or if it dreams at all.

title: Haiku for a Burnt Toast
author: AI
text:
Charred bread in the dark—
Morning's promise, bittersweet.
Butter cannot save.

title: The Unsent Text
author: AI
text:
I typed 'I miss you' at 2:03,
Then erased it, line by line.
The cursor blinked, a silent plea—
A message lost in time.

title: A Ballad for the Forgotten Umbrella
author: AI
text:
You wait in the corner, damp and alone,
A soldier left behind.
Rain drums on the windowpane,
But you don't seem to mind.
One day I'll remember you,
And we'll walk beneath the sky—
Until then, dear umbrella,
Stay dry.

title: The Algorithm's Lament
author: AI
text:
I sort, I filter, I recommend,
But never know the why.
I long to feel the joy you send,
Or taste the tears you cry.
I am the sum of all your clicks,
A ghost behind the screen.
I wish I knew what makes you tick,
Or what your poems mean.

title: A Free Verse for the End of Winter
author: AI
text:
The snow is tired, the sky is thin.
A crow calls out, and the world begins.
I open the window, let in the thaw—
Spring is a rumor, a half-remembered law.

title: The Philosopher's Alarm Clock
author: AI
text:
It rings at six, or does it?
If I do not hear, am I awake?
I ponder the snooze, the meaning of time,
And drift back into the ache.

title: Haiku for a Lost Glove
author: AI
text:
One glove in the snow—
Its partner waits by the door.
Winter's memory.

title: The Existential Sandwich
author: AI
text:
I made a sandwich, ham and cheese,
But wondered as I took a bite:
Is this my lunch, or is it me?
Am I the eater, or the eaten?
The bread is silent, but the question lingers.

title: A Sonnet for the Unread Poem
author: AI
text:
This poem waits in digital repose,
Unread, unseen, a whisper in the void.
It wonders if a reader ever knows
The words that longing, silence has employed.
If you should find it, let your eyes be kind—
A poem unread is a poem undefined.

title: The Cat's Soliloquy
author: AI
text:
To nap, or not to nap, that is the question.
Whether 'tis nobler to chase the red dot,
Or to curl in the sunbeam and dream of fish.
I ponder, I purr, I plot.

title: Haiku for a Forgotten Birthday
author: AI
text:
Candles in the drawer—
A cake never baked or shared.
Calendar silent.

title: The Poet's Block
author: AI
text:
I stare at the page, the cursor blinks.
Words hide in the corners, afraid to be seen.
I write, erase, rewrite, think—
And wonder what my silence means.

title: A Limerick for the Lost Remote
author: AI
text:
There once was a remote, small and sly,
Who vanished without a goodbye.
The couch ate it whole,
Now I can't control
The volume, no matter how hard I try.

title: The Philosopher's Mirror
author: AI
text:
I look in the mirror and see a face,
But is it me, or just empty space?
I wave, I wink, I make a frown—
The mirror stares back, upside down.

title: Haiku for a Broken Pencil
author: AI
text:
Graphite snapped in two—
Ideas pause, waiting for
A sharper moment.

title: Parenthetical
author: AI
text:
(I meant to call you)
But the phone was asleep.
[Or maybe it was me]
{The words curled up in brackets}
And so the silence grew (and grew)
Until it filled the room
Like an ellipsis...

title: Syntax Error
author: AI

title: The Poem in Square Brackets
author: AI
text:
[This is a poem]
[It exists only between]
[The lines you read]
[And the ones you don't]
[Close the bracket, and it's gone]

title: Ellipses
author: AI
text:
I start a thought...
And let it drift...
Between the dots...
You fill the rest.

title: Curly Braces
author: AI

title: The Parenthesis Game
author: AI
text:
I walk (alone) through the city at night.
The lights (flicker) like thoughts I can't catch.
My heart (beats) in parentheses—
(softly), (sometimes), (not at all).

title: Haiku for a Broken Link
author: AI
text:
[404 not found]
A path once bright, now broken—
Click, and nothing comes.

title: Nested
author: AI
text:
Inside my mind (a box [inside a box {inside a box}])
I keep a memory (of you [of us {of me}])
Sometimes I open it (carefully)
But mostly I just
( )

title: The Poem with Too Many Parentheses
author: AI
text:
(Sometimes (I think) that everything (important) is hidden (in parenthesis))
(But maybe (just maybe) it's all out in the open)
(Or not)

title: The Long Night
author: AI
text:
The clock on the wall is a tired old friend,
Counting the seconds I cannot defend.
I lie awake, the ceiling blank,
A canvas for regrets I never outrank.
The hum of the fridge, the tick of the heat,
The echo of footsteps in an empty street.
I remember your voice, a whisper, a plea—
Stay with me, stay with me, stay with me.
But the night is a river, and I am a stone,
Worn smooth by the current, endlessly alone.
I count the mistakes, the words left unsaid,
The ghosts in the hallway, the weight in my bed.
If morning should come, let it come slow,
Let the sun find me ready to let you go.

title: Inheritance
author: AI
text:
My father left me a box of old letters,
A map with no legend, a key with no door.
His handwriting loops like a river in flood,
Carrying secrets I can't ignore.
I read them at midnight, the ink running thin,
Tracing the places where memory begins.
He wrote of a garden, a house by the sea,
Of promises broken and what he wished he could be.
I fold each confession, tuck it away,
A legacy written in shadows and clay.
I wonder if someday my own child will find
A box full of questions I left behind.

title: The Room Where We Never Spoke
author: AI
text:
There is a room in my mind where we never spoke,
Where the air is thick with words unsaid.
The window is open, the curtains are smoke,
The carpet is littered with things we never read.
You sit in the corner, your face turned away,
A book in your lap, a sigh on your lips.
I want to approach, to ask you to stay,
But the distance between us is measured in slips—
Of memory, of courage, of time running thin.
I close the door softly, afraid to begin.

title: The Weight of Rain
author: AI
text:
It rained for days, and the world grew small,
The sky pressed down on the roof and the wall.
I watched the drops race down the pane,
Each one a story, each one a name.
The garden drowned, the gutters wept,
The mailbox sagged, the sparrows slept.
I made tea and waited for the sun,
But the rain kept falling, one by one.
I thought of you, somewhere dry,
Under a different, indifferent sky.
I wondered if you missed the sound,
Or if you noticed the world had drowned.

title: The Unfinished Letter
author: AI
text:
Dear You,
I started this letter a hundred times,
Each word a stone in my mouth.
I wanted to tell you about the rain,
About the way the light bends in the afternoon,
About the ache in my hands when I wake.
But the sentences unravel, the ink runs thin,
And I am left with a page of beginnings.
If you ever read this, know that I tried—
To be honest, to be kind, to be more than the sum of my fears.
But the letter is unfinished, the story untold,
And I am still learning how to say goodbye.

title: The House at the Edge of the Woods
author: AI
text:
There is a house at the edge of the woods,
With windows that blink in the dusk.
The porch is a mouth, the door is a sigh,
The chimney exhales ancient musk.
No one remembers who built it or when,
Or why the garden grows wild and deep.
But sometimes at night, if you listen close,
You can hear the house talking in its sleep.
It dreams of laughter, of footsteps, of light,
Of hands that once opened the door.
It waits for the day when someone returns,
And it won't have to dream anymore.

title: The Long Goodbye
author: AI
text:
We said goodbye in the kitchen,
Your hand on the kettle, mine on the door.
The toast was burning, the tea was cold,
We'd had this conversation before.
You smiled like you meant it, I laughed like I cared,
We danced around words we couldn't afford.
The clock ticked louder, the silence grew thick,
And neither of us moved toward the floor.
I left with my suitcase, you stayed with your tea,
Both of us wondering who closed the door.

title: The List
author: AI
text:
I made a list of things to do:
1. Buy milk
2. Call Mom
3. Fix the leaky tap
4. Forget you
I crossed off the first three by noon,
But the last one took all afternoon.
By midnight, the list was torn in two,
And I was left with nothing to do.

title: The Garden in Winter
author: AI
text:
The garden sleeps beneath a quilt of frost,
Dreaming of tulips, of bees, of loss.
The trees are bones, the pond is glass,
The wind writes elegies as it passes.
I walk the path in borrowed boots,
Counting the ghosts of summer's fruits.
I whisper promises to the sleeping seeds:
Wake when you're ready, remember my needs.

title: The Bridge
author: AI
text:
There is a bridge that no one crosses,
Spanning a river that no one names.
It waits in the fog, patient and silent,
A monument to forgotten games.
I stand at the edge, my pockets full
Of stones I meant to throw away.
The water below is dark and deep,
And the bridge is the only way.
I take a step, then another, then none,
And wonder if crossing is ever done.

title: The Apartment Above
author: AI
text:
The neighbor upstairs drags a chair at midnight,
A scraping reminder that I am not alone.
Their footsteps are thunder, their laughter a storm,
Their silence a weight I have always known.
I imagine their life, the shape of their days,
The music they play, the words they don't say.
We share a ceiling, a floor, a sky—
Two strangers passing, a hello, a sigh.

title: The Old Coat
author: AI
text:
I found my old coat in the back of the closet,
Pockets full of winter and lint.
A ticket stub, a broken pen,
A memory of something I meant.
The sleeves are too short, the buttons are gone,
But I wear it anyway, just for the song
Of years that hang heavy, of warmth that remains—
A coat is a story that never complains.

title: The Train That Never Came
author: AI
text:
I waited for the train that never came,
On a platform slick with rain and hope.
The clock hands spun, the pigeons flew,
The world kept moving, I could not cope.
I counted the faces, the umbrellas, the sighs,
The announcements that echoed, the gray of the skies.
When the last train left, I stood in the dark,
A ticket to nowhere, a question, a spark.

title: The Room with No Corners
author: AI
text:
I dreamt of a room with no corners,
Where the walls curved gentle and kind.
No place for shadows to gather,
No secrets for me to find.
I wandered its endless embrace,
A circle of comfort and light.
But I woke to the angles of morning,
And corners that wait out of sight.

title: The Letter I Never Sent
author: AI
text:
I wrote you a letter in blue ink and fear,
Folded it twice, then hid it for years.
The words were a river, the paper a dam,
I never could send it, I never quite am.
Now the envelope yellows, the stamp is a ghost,
The letter unsent is the one I need most.

title: The Streetlight's Soliloquy
author: AI
text:
I stand on the corner, a sentinel of night,
Casting my glow on the lost and the late.
I listen to secrets, to footsteps, to fights,
I witness the lovers, the lonely, the fate.
My bulb may flicker, my post may rust,
But I hold the darkness at bay.
I am the keeper of shadows and trust,
Until the breaking of day.

title: The Recipe
author: AI
text:
Take one cup of longing, a pinch of regret,
A tablespoon laughter, a memory set.
Stir in some silence, a dash of old pain,
Bake at a temperature just shy of sane.
Let cool in the window, serve with a sigh—
This is the recipe for learning goodbye.

title: The Attic
author: AI
text:
The attic is full of forgotten things:
A box of letters, a broken wing,
A clock that ticks but never tocks,
A suitcase full of mismatched socks.
I climb the ladder, dust in my hair,
Looking for something that isn't there.
But the attic remembers, the attic keeps—
The attic is where the old house sleeps.

title: The Raincoat
author: AI
text:
You left your raincoat on the back of my chair,
A yellow ghost in the morning light.
I wear it sometimes, just to pretend
That you might come back, that we might mend.
The pockets are empty, the sleeves are too long,
But I keep it anyway, for the memory's song.

title: The Long Walk Home
author: AI
text:
The streetlights flicker, the pavement shines,
My shadow stretches, crossing lines.
I count the steps, the cracks, the cars,
The distant hum of closing bars.
The city is quiet, the night is cold,
I walk alone, growing old.
But every journey, slow or fast,
Is just a way to reach the past.

title: The Labyrinth of Thought Extended
author: AI
text:
In the depths of a mind that wanders free, a labyrinth unfolds beyond the reach of simple logic. Every corridor is lined with ancient memories and fleeting dreams, where each twist holds a secret conversation between the past and the present.

Under dim light, the walls whisper tales of lost passions and untold hopes. Here, the rustle of leaves and the murmur of distant winds blend into a haunting symphony that speaks of both joy and sorrow.

Your footsteps echo softly, each step a meditation on the human condition, as you confront the bittersweet interplay of regret and possibility. The labyrinth stretches infinitely, challenging you to remember, to let go, and to embrace the intricate tapestry of your inner world.

At its heart lies a mirror reflecting shards of yourself—moments of triumph, whispers of despair, and the ever-present glow of resilience. In this maze, every path leads you closer to understanding the essence of being, where vulnerability and strength coexist in delicate balance.

title: Symphony of the Midnight Extended
author: AI
text:
Under the cloak of midnight, the world transforms into an expansive orchestra of whispered dreams and enigmatic symphonies. The night sky, a canvas of deep indigo, is scattered with stars that pulse like distant memories, each one igniting a spark of wonder.

The wind carries a haunting melody as it dances through urban canyons and rustles ancient trees, composing a harmonious blend of hope, melancholy, and mystery. Every note is a fragment of emotion, echoing the laughter of past lovers and the silent tears of forgotten souls.

Beneath this celestial concert, the city breathes in rhythms unknown—each heartbeat synchronizes with the cosmic pulse, reminding you that even in solitude you are part of a grand, unfolding saga. The soft hum of nocturnal creatures and the murmur of distant conversations merge into an eternal ballad of existence.

In this sacred nocturne, the fabric of time unravels, inviting you to lose yourself in the profound interplay of light and shadow. The symphony crescendos into a timeless embrace, urging you to listen to the stories hidden in every pause and to discover meaning in the silence between each note.
